Interface Entity

All Superinterfaces:
krystal.CheckImportantFieldsInterface, LoggingInterface, PersistenceInterface
public interface Entity extends PersistenceInterface, krystal.CheckImportantFieldsInterface
A subject for persistence.

Essential elements:

NoArgsConstructor - a must be
Constructor without arguments.
TableInterface - a must be
Implement by using Table annotation or overriding PersistenceInterface.getTable() method.
Constructor(String)
Defining constructor for single String argument is a must for KrystalServlet single GET mapping (i.e. "/api/v1/entity/123", where "123" is passed as argument).
CheckImportantFieldsInterface.ExplicitImportance
The KrystalServlet single object GET implementation validates the returned instance with CheckImportantFieldsInterface.noneIsNull() method. This option can limit fields being taken to predicate (up to none).
ColumnInterface
Each Field of a class is treated as a database column with name exact as field's. To declare a different column name, either use Column on the field, or declare ColumnsMapping.
Key
Fields marked will be treated as object's identifiers within database. Can overlap primary keys, but not necessarily.
See also: SeparateKeys, Incremental
Vertical
A way to unpivot underlying Loader query before passing to object constructor.
Skip
Field marked will be excluded from persistence operations.
See also: Loader, Filter, Reader, Writer, ReadOnly, PersistenceMemory
See Also:
